experience: You and Mark both know Mike Hawksworth, Mark Goldstein, and 57 others

I think the capacity to love and have empathy for people is an essential ingredient for business. The fact human beings exist on these two things is fundamental to existence. And the fact that a company is made of people is often lost on most people. I grew up being told you have to be shrewd and smart with people in business. And then the management guys came and told me a lot of things on strategy, markets and finance. Yet to meet a bloke who talks about passion, love and empathy as fundamental building blocks of a company. People are not "Resources". They are human beings first. And the difference between "good" and "great" is actually a motivated team.

Selected by the Arizona Governor to lead business transformation for the $7.5B Arizona agency. Led a 170 person Application Development, Operations, and Support teams. Managed a $31M P&L. turning a $38M state investment over 5 years into a $40M savings year over year.  •	Directed business case and product roadmap to documenting journey to save $111M in savings.•	Led negotiation effort for financial backing for IT business plan from key stakeholders.•	Re-vitalized legacy $5B finance system providing 99.99% availability from less than 50%. •	Lowered software delivery costs by 32% through implementation of Dev-Ops and agile development.•	Decreased operations cost by 40% through re-architecture 156 business systems and services.         o	Partnered with business units and customers to take ownership of their application/product roadmap.•	Executing on multi-year initiative to introduce enterprise cloud architecture framework. •	Converted poor IT customer experience into a world class delivery and operational excellence.        o	In less than 12 months, call center went from 50% abandoned calls to 85% answered in 20 seconds.        o	Reduced service interruptions by 80% through the ITIL implementation and CMMI process compliance.
Global Logistics Consultant for Global Trade Corporation
DP/DHL Head of Shared Systems and Management Reporting (VP of IT)

Responsible for 250-person global team with direct P&L of $90M in four centers of excellence (Prague, Kuala Lumpur, Bonn, and Scottsdale). Led on-shore, near-shore and off-shore agile application development teams for critical business and customer facing systems that included Oracle, Siebel, SAP, Web Methods and Teradata.  •	Led America's modernization of legacy HR, Customer Service and Business Intelligence applicationso	 Included PeopleSoft (HR) and SAP, and Web integration ensuring global business transparency.•	Delivery of over 300 on-time, high quality solutions using both SDLC and agile methodology.•	Led solution architecture team through application roadmap exerciseo	 Resulting in lower cost of ownership by 40% through implementation of Systems as Services (SOA).•	Directed go-to-market strategy for SAP Financial and Controlling build services in Latin America.o	Reduced TCO by 25% through design/build of easy to deploy and repeatable product templates.•	Executed DHL’s global complex data center relocation program (3000 Servers, 3 Mainframes).  Zero customer impacts resulting in $48M savings.
DP/DHL Director Operations for Enterprise Accounting Systems

Transformed dysfunctional a 30 person team responsible for implementation, quality assurance, security, admin and support activities for billing, finance and ecommerce systems on multiple platforms.  •	Turned around a troubled operations and support team in less than 90 days.•	Direct ITIL Problem and Service Management Process for Scottsdale Center increasing system reliability. •	Completely turned around the America Finance customer relationship in less than 6 months•	Successfully implemented over 350 integration projects resulting from Acquisition of Airborne in America.  •	Orchestrated IT/Business solution to reduce Unapplied Cash from $100M to below $4M in 90 days.•	Uncovered significant revenue problems that created reporting shortfalls in excess of $6.5M.o	Led internal and external cross functional teams to execute a plan that rebuilt 6 months of data.
International Business and IT Program Management
International Business and IT Program Management
College/University Preparatory and Advanced High School/Secondary Diploma Program

I would welcome an opportunity to work with him again and would recommend him without hesitation.

Mark was responsible for effective provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware and software and related infrastructure. He participated in technical research and development to enable continuing innovation within the infrastructure. Mark ensured that system hardware, operating systems, software systems, and related procedures adhere to organizational values, enabling students and staff.Mark lead project teams with technical issues in the Initiation and Planning phases of our standard Project Management Methodology. These activities include the definition of needs, benefits, and technical strategy; research & development within the project life-cycle; technical analysis and design; and support of operations staff in executing, testing and rolling-out the solutions. Participation on projects is focused on smoothing the transition of projects from development staff to production staff by performing operations activities within the project life-cycle.

summary: Mark is a Global Information Technology Executive who is a customer focused, a business visionary who has extensive experience in leading large scale Business and IT Transformations in multiple industries from Retail, Transportation, and Logistics to Government.  He builds remarkable teams.  In 2017 “Network World” recognized the Arizona Education Department with a Gold Medal Award for Best Education Product.  In 2015 his team was recognized as CIO magazines top 100 most innovative IT organizations.   In 2014 Mark was personally recognized as one of Computer World’s top 100 Technologist. His personal and team awards demonstrate strategic leadership, delivering highly innovative business solutions that transform organizations, deliver greater ROI, reduce costs, and improve efficiency through higher quality. The most recent technology transformation was the complete revitalization of Arizona’s $5B school financial payment and reporting systems.  Leveraging lean principles he led the conversion of legacy systems from data center server based systems to cloud based virtual systems enabling 650 districts to reduce overhead by $50M annually.  In addition leveraging his extensive supply-chain experience he deployed the nation’s first Education Intelligence (EI) system that enables students, teachers and administrators real-time student information that enables teacher/student intervention that immediately impacts Arizona’s workforce.  He brings extensive experience in delivering high value software solutions, he has a comprehensive portfolio of experience in full life-cycle Information Technology solutions and Process implementation. He is an ITIL (ISO 20000) and CMMI champion and is an expert at large program and project management delivery and execution.Mark’s leadership has been continually recognized by Chief Executives through his selection for the toughest business impacting roles that solve real customer frustrations and deliver value to the bottom line.
name: Mark Masterson
title: Vice President Government Solutions at LearningMate
